meanings.definition: A person who renounces a religious or political belief.
meanings.sent1: The apostate left his church and joined a different one.
meanings.sent2: She was labeled an apostate after publicly denouncing her former political party.
meanings.sent3: The apostate joked that he now worships the 'Church of Netflix'.
meanings.sent4: Her departure from the party was seen as a betrayal, like an apostate in the world of politics.
meanings.sent5: The town remembered him as the apostate who turned his back on tradition.

meanings.definition: To abandon a religious or political belief.
meanings.sent1: He decided to apostate from his faith and explore other spiritual paths.
meanings.sent2: They warned him that if he apostates, he will be excommunicated from the community.
meanings.sent3: The politician's sudden decision to apostate caused quite a stir among his supporters.
meanings.sent4: Her choice to apostate was like tearing up the map of her beliefs and starting anew.
meanings.sent5: The act of apostating felt like shedding an old skin and stepping into the unknown.
